history.narrative: Law 9-125, the “Bail Reform Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-360, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 4, 1992, and March 3, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 20, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-170 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-125 became effective on July 3, 1992.
